meanings.sent1: The roof of the old house was slatier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The slatier tiles gave the kitchen a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The slatier sky made the artist want to paint a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were as slatier as the stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The slatier rocks along the shore sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Having the color or texture of slate.
meanings.sent1: The slatier walls in the room made it feel cold.
meanings.sent2: The slatier floor tiles were easy to clean.
meanings.sent3: The slatier notebook cover reminded him of a chalkboard.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as slatier as the sound of rain on a tin roof.
meanings.sent5: The slatier fabric of the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
